net.tinyos.prowler.floodrouting

Interface RoutingPolicy


  • public interface RoutingPolicy
    The implementation of this class defines a state automaton, where the actions are predetermined by this interface.
    Author:
    Gabor Pap (gabor.pap@vanderbilt.edu)

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean accept(int location)
      It is used by the FloodRouting enginge when a data packet is received.
      int age(int priority)
      It is used by the FloodRouting engine when a data packet is aged.
      int getLocation()
      It is used by the FloodRouting engine to get the "location" of this node.
      int received(int location, int priority)
      It is used by the FloodRouting engine when a data packet is received, and this policy returned SUCCESS in accept().
      int sent(int priority)
      It is used by the FloodRouting engine when a data has been successfully sent.

    • Method Detail

      • getLocation

        int getLocation()
        It is used by the FloodRouting engine to get the "location" of this node. The meaning of the "location" is policy dependent: it can be a constant value, hop count from a root, 2D offset of the physical location from some center, or something else.

      • sent

        int sent(int priority)
        It is used by the FloodRouting engine when a data has been successfully sent. The policy implementation should change the priority so it does not send the same packets in an infinite loop. IMPORTANT: This command is called when the packet was sent, and by this time the priority might not be the same as it was when this packet was selected for sending. In particular, the packet can be odd, if the old even value was changed in received() or age().
        Parameters:
        priority - The old priority of the data packet.
        Returns:
        The new priority of the data packet. Return 0xFF to drop this packet.

      • accept

        boolean accept(int location)
        It is used by the FloodRouting enginge when a data packet is received. The policy implementation can indicate to drop this packet.
        Parameters:
        location - The location of the sender.
        Returns:
        false to drop this packet, or true to start searching for a match and the packet table.

      • received

        int received(int location,
           int priority)
        It is used by the FloodRouting engine when a data packet is received, and this policy returned SUCCESS in accept(). The policy implementation can change the priority of the packet.
        Parameters:
        location - The location of the sender.
        priority - 0x00 if this data packet is new at this node, or the existing priority of the matching packet.
        Returns:
        The new priority of the data packet. Return 0xFF to drop this packet.

      • age

        int age(int priority)
        It is used by the FloodRouting engine when a data packet is aged. The policy implementation should "increase" the priority and eventually set it to 0xFF (free).
        Parameters:
        priority - The old priority of the data packet.
        Returns:
        The new priority of the data packet. Return 0xFF to drop this packet.
